column2: IPA: [sɐˈjansk]) is a town in Irkutsk Oblast
column4: located on the Oka River (Angara River's basin) 270 kilometers (170 mi) northwest of Irkutsk. Population: 40

column1: Sayansk was founded in 1970. It was granted urban-type settlement status in 1975 and town status in 1985.
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: it is incorporated as the Town of Sayansk—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column3: the Town of Sayansk is incorporated as Sayansk Urban Okrug.
